repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
fix(winblend): add \u2800 as blank unicode character

Problem:
Winblend does not display text behind blank unicode characters other than 0x20 ascii space
Fix #32254

Solution:
In `ui_compositor.c` -> `compose_line()` make variable `thru` be true for either 0x20 or 0x80A0E2 (utf8 of \u2800)

~~I'm not really familiar with the codebase, so I think this solution could not work for big or small endian (see `schar_from_ascii` implementation)~~ (edit: fixed)
I'd love any feedback on how to go further

comment_data.body:
I think the puc-lua CI job is failing because `\u` is a luajit-only feature. try this (byte literals instead of unicode codepoint) (I didn't verify the bytes, this is from AI):

```suggestion
      local braille_blank = "\226\160\128"
      api.nvim_buf_set_lines(buf, 0, -1, true, {"test" .. braille_blank, "", "popup"..braille_blank.."   text"})
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -7947,7 +7947,7 @@ describe('float window', function()
         qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est
         laborum.]])
       local buf = api.nvim_create_buf(false,false)
-      api.nvim_buf_set_lines(buf, 0, -1, true, {"test", "", "popup    text"})
+      api.nvim_buf_set_lines(buf, 0, -1, true, {"test\u{2800}", "", "popup\u{2800}   text"})

comment_data.body: I would also recommend restricting this to a single test instead of modifying all the tests; that makes isolating failures easier. (Or just copy the simplest one and add the non-space blank.)

+      api.nvim_buf_set_lines(buf, 0, -1, true, {"test\u{2800}", "", "popup\u{2800}   text"})

comment_data.body:
Ohhhh, that makes a lot more sense
The result indeed seemed weird to me
I just wanted to run this once more through CI to make sure it wasn't just github acting weird

this case doesn't test the char?

is there any way to make the test that you added, less verbose? this is a lot of code just to test a single char.

comment_data.body:
It's on purpose
This case is for when the windows overlap, so we **don't** render the `\u2800` but we render the character underneath (because winblend > 0)

I agree the solution is verbose, but so are all the tests for winblend, so I'm not sure we can make it less verbose without refactoring some parts of the other tests

comment_regular_data.body:
Should be all good
Anything else or it can be merged ?

Seems like somebody else proposed another more complete fix : #32761 
Should this PR be closed without merge in favor of the other ?

That is a much more intrusive (and questionable) approach, so let's keep this open.

Please have a bit of patience until one of the experts (which are few and very busy) has time to look at this in detail. Open source is a marathon, not a sprint.

that lint failure looks like something that was resolved awhile ago, try rebasing.

then I think we can merge this.

All green :+1: 
Should I also write a test or is it overkill for such little change ?
should be possible to modify an existing 'winblend' test to add this char in the test.

title: fix(winblend): treat braille blank (\u2800) as whitespace #32741
